bibl.title: Report: The Line of Investigation Which was Proposed for Mr. Dunn, by [Henry Hanson], [19--]

div1.p: [Hanson] suggests details for Dunn's investigation of mosquitoes.

div1.head: Report: The Line of Investigation Which was Proposed for Mr. Dunn, by [Henry Hanson], [19--]
div1.opener:
I H. B
Sleg
DIRECTOR GENERAL
HENRY HANSON
M. D.
BAJO LOS AUSPICIOS DEL
GOBIERNO PERUANO Y LA
JUNTA INTERNACIONAL DE
SANIDAD DE ROCKEFELLER
FOUNDATION
Campaña Sanitaria contra la Fiebre Amarilla en el Perú

AVENIDA PIEROLA 545 -- TELEFONO 3420
LIMA -- PERU
NUMERO
------

p.hi: THE LINE OF INVESTIGATION WHICH WAS PROPOSED FOR MR. DUNN.

div1.p:
The following are points on which there is a lack of in-
formation, and on which it was hoped that more data might be
obtained are data by the following program,

NATURAL ENEMIES:
1. a. Fish, b. Camarones (shrimp), c. Culex larvae.
2. Canabalism:- Large larvae devour small larvae.
Longevity. - of female; of male; of adults
without food.
3, FEEDING, and OVIPOSITION.
a,
To determine frequency of blood meals and
number of batches of eggs laid when receiv-
ing a blood diet only.
b. Pair to be given other food,- no blood. To
test if female will deposit viable eggs
without blood.
4. Effect of climate.
5. " " altitude.
6. " " Temperature.
7. Distribution of the Stegomya.

p.hi: Some of the details of the work.

item.p:
EGG LAYING.- First deposition after emergence.
" " " first blood meal.
" " " copulation.
Will deposit both day and night.
" " more than one batch of eggs without a
second blood meal.

The placing ov the eggs on container in water.
Deposit more in light or dark containers.
Effect og human scent on containers.
Maximum and minimum number per batch.

list.item:
HATCHING. - Time of hatching, shortest and longest.
Length of time eggs remain viable when dry, etc.
Effect of sterile water on eggs.- do of contaminated.

EFFECT OF,
SULPHUR, ALUM, CHARCOAL, and degree of salinity.

div1.p: 2. LINE OF INVESTIGATION WHICH WAS PROPOSED FOR MR. DUNH.

item.p:
Freequency, time consumed in meal. Distension.
Amount of blood taken. Day or night feeding.
Number and frequency of blood meals, taken by virgin
female without other food.

NUMBER of blood meals taken by pair in jar without
other food.

NUMBER of blood meals taken by pair in jar with other
food. ditto for VIRGIN.

Test to determine if difference in feeding between
light or dark room.

list.item: Copulation before first meal of male or female.
Affect of light or dark on copulation.
Averlength of time for copulation, position during act.
Number of females fertilized by one male.
Number of males with which one female will copulate.
Effect of jarring of cage and excitement on copulation.
Will one copulation serve to fertilize female for life.

MOVEMENTS. - of engorded female, of unengorged.
Of male when young and when old.

div1.p:
Information is still incomplete on the above characteristics
of the Stegomya. Several of the above are of considerable practi-
cal value.
